title: Strictly Come Dancing's Katya Jones denies being 'drunk' after fall
text:
I love that Katya’s fall was so dramatically flamboyant. #Strictly pic.twitter.com/LDwW0wfOyK — Amanda (@Pandamoanimum) October 5, 2019

Strictly’s Katya Jones has laughed off her two dramatic falls on the show, insisting the second one was staged.

The Russian dancer had fans shocked when she dropped to the floor during her Magic Mike routine with journalist Mike Bushell, and fell again at the top of the stairs when she was talking to presenter Claudia Winkleman.

However, while the first mishap was unfortunately very real, she insisted that the second one was ‘on purpose.’

‘Guys! I’m totally fine! No idea what happened [cry-laughing emoijis],’ she tweeted. ‘So sorry . But so proud of @mikebreakfast for carrying on and delivering “the dolphin”!’

FYI I did it again on purpose in Claudia’s area! And im def not drunk as some people think. — katya Jones (@Mrs_katjones) October 5, 2019

The star added: ‘FYI I did it again on purpose in Claudia’s area! And im def not drunk as some people think.’

The pro dancer, who previously faced controversy when she was pictured last year snogging her dance partner Seann Walsh, performed a raunchy dance to The Weather Girls’ It’s Raining Men with her partner but one move went just a little (a lot) wrong.

After a lovely spin and following Mike across the studio, Katya dropped to the floor – with some fans assuming he was meant to be there to catch her.

‘It wasn’t quite magic, it was nearly tragic in parts,’ judge Bruno Tonioli asserted, with Katya insisting: ‘It wasn’t his fault!’

Fans were shocked by the unfortunate mishap, with one writing on Twitter: ‘Katya actually styled this out really well,’ and another adding: ‘WAIT did Katya just fall over.’

The pair earned a score of 18 from the judges for their dance, which saw the journalist sliding down a fireman’s pole before ripping off the uniform to reveal his glittery outfit.

At least they had fun, right?

Strictly Come Dancing returns tomorrow at 7.15 on BBC One.
